icontrol.dialogs

Class WrongIDN

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • icontrol.dialogs.WrongIDN
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class WrongIDN
extends javax.swing.JDialog
    This class presents a JDialog to the user after an invalid response to an *IDN query was received. It presents the user with 4 choices, namely to stop scripting, to switch to No-Communication Mode, to accept the Instrument's response once or to store it in the User properties. After instantiating this class, a call to AskUser shows the modal dialog and returns with the answer of the user as defined in the ACTION_... constants.
    Version:
    0.3
    Author:
    KPP (Kurt Pernstich: pernstich@alumni.ethz.ch)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        This method is called from within the constructor to initialize the form. WARNING: Do NOT modify this code. The content of this method is always regenerated by the Form Editor.

      • AskUser

        public int AskUser()
        Displays the dialog and waits until the User makes a choice or closes the Dialog, in which case the default behavior (ACTION_STOP) will be selected.

        If the user selected to accept the Instrument response to a *IDN? query permanently, the appropriate entry in the iC.properties is updated.

        Returns:
        The value of the action the user has selected. The values are defined in the constants, for instance ACTION_ACCEPT.

      • SelectOption

        @Action
public void SelectOption()
        Action which is executed when the user presses the 'Select Option' button.
